metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11487 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 5.1-rc5 allows page->_refcount reference count overflow, with resultant use-after-free issues, if about 140 GiB of RAM exists. This is related to fs/fuse/dev.c, fs/pipe.c, fs/splice.c, include/linux/mm.h, include/linux/pipe_fs_i.h, kernel/trace/trace.c, mm/gup.c, and mm/hugetlb.c. It can occur with FUSE requests. It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the Linux kernel when reference counting pages, leading to potential use-after-free issues. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
